properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally heavy rain tonight into early Thursday morning. Rain associated with clusters of showers and thunderstorms moving across portions of the area tonight will produce locally heavy rainfall amounts in the 40 to 50 mm range. Ponding on roadways and flooding in low lying areas will be possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-16T20:07:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T04:11:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1269816594.2020
Area: Blind River - Thessalon, Espanola - Killarney, Manitoulin Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong southerly wind gusts will reach up to 100 kilometres per hour tonight. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-16T11:22:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-15T19:23:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3093625895.2020
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Patchy frost expected overnight tonight. Locations: Low lying inland areas along the west coast from St. George's to Gros Morne and the Great Northern Peninsula. Remarks: Light winds and clear skies will create conditions favourable for the development of frost as temperatures in some areas dip as low as 2 C. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-16T09:59:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T01:06:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0725561851.2020
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Northern Peninsula East, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Scattered thunderstorms are developing over parts of central and eastern Manitoba this afternoon. These thunderstorms will have the potential to produce very strong wind gusts. The thunderstorm threat will diminish early this evening. This severe thunderstorm watch may be expanded southwards as thunderstorm development is monitored this afternoon. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-16T05:00:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-15T17:43:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3312987035.2020
Area: Oxford House and Gods Lake, Red Sucker Lake, Island Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts. Hazards... Isolated wind gusts of 90 km/h and nickel size hail Timing... Into the early evening Summary... Scattered thunderstorms will continue to affect the watch area into the early evening. A few wind gusts of 70 to 80 km/h have been observed with these storms. The primary threat from stronger cells will continue to be locally severe wind gusts. Isolated nickel size hail is also possible. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-07-16T06:59:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-15T21:38:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2849611211.2020
Area: Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell, Summer Beaver - Wunnummin Lake - Kingfisher Lake, Pickle Lake - Cat Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain will continue this evening. Total rainfall: 50 mm. Locations: eastern Avalon. Time span: continuing until overnight tonight. ### Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots are expected or occurring in the area. Thunderstorms near Thunder Bay will move east across western Superior early tonight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-16T05:35:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-16T01:37:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4148877165.2020
Area: Western Lake Superior
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Frost is expected overnight tonight. Light winds and clear skies will create conditions favourable for the development of frost as temperatures dip to single digits and in some areas as low as minus one. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-16T08:13:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-15T16:14:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1852548753.2020
